rules.reasoning: GC analysis shows max pause time of {data.get('max_pause_time')}s or max heap usage of {data.get('max_usage_percent')}%. High GC pauses or heap pressure can cause latency spikes and reduced throughput in Cassandra operations.
recommendations: Tune JVM parameters: Increase heap size if physical memory allows (-Xms -Xmx)
Analyze GC logs: Enable -XX:+PrintGCDetails and review for frequent full GCs
Optimize application: Reduce object creation rates and check for memory leaks
Consider GC tuning: Adjust survivor ratios or switch to low-pause GC like G1GC
Monitor with tools: Use jstat or VisualVM to profile heap usage over time
